question: AIDS Question?
question_content: I feel stupid asking this but anyways, if you get AIDs from intercourse then how are you supposed to have kids?

answers.answer_content:
Yours is a good question, it's a disease that many times will not show any serious signs or complications, other than the early symptoms of contraction.

Today, a healthy female and a healthy male together having natural reproductive intercourse will produce HIV free children, that is if they are virgins, are HIV free, and have not had any tainted blood transfusions.

The risky behavior of homo sexuality, unprotected anal sex, and having sex outside the marriage can result in the contraction of the virus.

I don't even get the question. You can only get AIDS if you have intercourse with someone who is infected with AIDS. You can also get it from blood like sharing needles or open cuts. But you can have kids if you have AIDS but there's a chance the kid might be born with AIDS.
The whole idea with an AIDS free generation is for people with AIDS not to have kids. It sucks but, it will help the World. So the final answer is, people with HIV/AIDS shouldn't have kids.

people do it all the time. and subsequently get AIDS. you know, I don't know. it's a very difficult question.

I suppose there are always other ways, like if the woman had AIDS, then there are ways of getting her pregnant that don't involve sex. but if it was the man that was infected, the woman could get infected because AIDS can be transmitted by semen. and either way, the child would probably have it.

You don't get AIDS from intercourse.  You can develop AIDS after you have been infected with HIV.  You can't be infected with HIV unless the person you're trying to have kids with is infected, so to answer your question, make sure the person you're trying to have kids with is HIV-.  Get tested.

It's really very easy. Both partners go to a clinic and get checked for HIV. If they are monogamous with each other and there is no HIV they can have all the kids they want and can afford.

If one partner is HIV+ sperm can be washes for fertilization and the eggs can be fertilized and then implanted. If that's not an option adoption is a great thing to do.
You don't get AIDS from intercourse, you could get it from intercourse with an infected partner!
In a monogamous relationship after you've both been tested.
Dude, Honestly...I don't think you should have any kids.
